nodes.documentation:
@title A Supply Chain prototype contract implementation.
@author Brian Ludlam
@notice All Supply Chain relevant data is stored on-chain, with all data erroneous 
to the system stored on IPFS. All information in the system, whether on-chain or on
IPFS, is impossible to change without a contract event logging the change, and all 
versions of all data can be permanently referenced on IPFS.
A Supply Chain is defined in this system as a Directed Acyclic Graph of supply steps 
that follow the production of something back to it's conception. A supply step always 
references a single item in the system, and may extend one or more previous supply steps, 
or precedents. A new step may only be added as a first step, or the last step of an existing 
supply chain. Approval must be granted to create a new supply step, which extends a supply 
step not owned directly.

devdoc.title: A Supply Chain prototype contract implementation.

addSupplyItem(uint256,bytes32,uint8,uint.notice: Transaction addSupplyItem - Add Supply Item to Supply Node as IPFS file.Must be Supply Node owner or operator, IPFS File multihash parts  must be relatively valid.

addSupplyNode(bytes32,uint8,uint8).notice: Transaction addSupplyNode - Add Supply Node with IPFS file data.IPFS File multihash parts must be relatively valid.

addSupplyStep(uint256,uint256,uint256[],.notice: Transaction addSupplyStep - Add Supply Step for Supply Item at Supply Node.Must be valid Supply Step (see validateSupplyStep(), IPFS File  multihash parts must be relatively valid.

approveNodeOp(uint256,address,bool).notice: Transaction approveNodeOp - Set approval for Supply Node operators by account address.must be owner of Supply Node.

approveSupplyNode(uint256,uint256,bool).notice: Transaction approveSupplyNode - Set approval for Supply Node access to existing  Supply Step.Must be owner of Supply Node owning Supply Step doing the approval.  .

isNodeOp(uint256,address).notice: View isNodeOp - Check address as Node operator.Supply Node owner only

itemLastStep(uint256).notice: View itemLastStep - Get last Supply Step of given Supply Item ID

removeSupplyItem(uint256).notice: Transaction removeSupplyItem - Remove Supply Item by ID.Must be Supply Node owner or operator, Item may not have active  Supply Steps.

removeSupplyNode(uint256).notice: Transaction removeSupplyNode - Remove Supply Node by ID.must be owner of Supply Node, Supply Node must exist and be inactive.

removeSupplyStep(uint256).notice: Transaction removeSupplyStep - Remove Supply Step by ID.Must be Supply Node owner or operator, must be Supply Items's  last Supply Step, must not have any active Supply Node approvals.

requestSupplyStep(uint256,uint256).notice: Transaction requestSupplyStep - Request for Supply Node access to existing Supply Step.Must be owner of Supply Node doing the request. Event-only effect,  address of Supply Step's Supply Node owner included for event trigger.

stepNodeApproved(uint256,uint256).notice: View stepNodeApproved - Get Supply Step approval status for Supply Node

stepPrecedents(uint256).notice: View stepPrecedents - Get precedents of given Supply Step ID

supplyItem(uint256).notice: View supplyItem - Get Supply Item data by ID.

supplyNode(uint256).notice: View supplyNode - Get Supply Node data by ID.

supplyStep(uint256).notice: View supplyStep - Get Supply Step data by ID.

validateSupplyStep(uint256,uint256,uint2.notice: View validateSupplyStep - Validates a potential Supply Step entry to see if it's valid.this check always occurs before adSupplyStep transaction, however can be called independently first to check vaidiity, to avoid transaction fail. Checks: Node is valid, sender is owner or operator of Supply Node adding the step,  item referenced is valid, all included precedents are themselves last steps of there  respective items, the nodeId adding them has approval to extend those steps, and adding  a step that is not the first step of a given item, must include that item's last step  as a precedent, given approval to do so.

userdoc.notice: All Supply Chain relevant data is stored on-chain, with all data erroneous  to the system stored on IPFS. All information in the system, whether on-chain or on IPFS, is impossible to change without a contract event logging the change, and all  versions of all data can be permanently referenced on IPFS. A Supply Chain is defined in this system as a Directed Acyclic Graph of supply steps  that follow the production of something back to it's conception. A supply step always  references a single item in the system, and may extend one or more previous supply steps,  or precedents. A new step may only be added as a first step, or the last step of an existing  supply chain. Approval must be granted to create a new supply step, which extends a supply  step not owned directly.
